member.name: M:System.Web.DomainServices.Tools.CreateRiaClientFilesTask.GenerateClientProxies
member.summary: Generates the client proxies.
member.remarks:
This method validates the presence of the necessary input server assemblies and then invokes the code generation logic to create a file containing the client proxies for the discovered server's Business Objects. If the file already exists and is newer than the inputs, this method does nothing.
In all success paths, the client proxy file will be added to the list of generated files so the custom targets file can add them to the @Compile collection.
member.returns: true if the client proxies were generated or were already up to date

member.name: M:System.Web.DomainServices.Tools.StandardCustomAttributeBuilder.BuildPropertyMaps(System.Attribute)
member.summary: Constructs a collection of PropertyMaps. A PropertyMap allows a "getter" property to redirect to a different "setter" property. Properties that should not be treated by code gen don't appear in the map. The getter/setter mapping is done because it is a relatively common scenario to have calculated properties that either cannot be set directly or should be effectively set through a different property.
member.param: The current attribute instance
member.returns: A list of instances.

member.name: T:System.Web.DomainServices.Tools.StandardCustomAttributeBuilder.PropertyMap
member.summary: Helper class used internally. A PropertyMap is simply a tuple that relates a property getter with its appropriate setter. Normally these are identical, but a surprising number of attributes expose calculated getters that are actually influenced by some other setter. By keeping these concepts separate, it is easier to allow derived classes to map computed getters to a better property.
